channel.title: SD Ruby Podcast
channel.description: SD Ruby. We are San Diego's Ruby community.
channel.itunes:author: SD Ruby
channel.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast

item.title: Episode 108: Fog: The Ruby Cloud Services Library
item.description:
James Miller demonstrates how to get up and running with Fog, including practical use cases, caveats, and how to make Fog better by contributing back.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
James Miller demonstrates how to get up and running with Fog, including practical use cases, caveats, and how to make Fog better by contributing back.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 107: Advanced Heroku with the Celadon Cedar Stack
item.description: Ryan Daigle and Blake Gentry explore all the new features in Heroku's Celadon Cedar stack.
item.itunes:summary: Ryan Daigle and Blake Gentry explore all the new features in Heroku's Celadon Cedar stack.

item.title: Episode 106: JRuby: Ruby in the JVM. Why on Earth?!?
item.description:
JRuby is a 100% pure-Java implementation of Ruby with high performance, real threading, and a vast array of libraries. Chris McCann explores how JRuby can provide real value for Rails developers.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
JRuby is a 100% pure-Java implementation of Ruby with high performance, real threading, and a vast array of libraries. Chris McCann explores how JRuby can provide real value for Rails developers.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 105: Get Your Flow On: Mastering Your Development Workflow
item.description:
Rob Kaufman explores tools and options for improving your development process: common issues with managing tasks, starting work, committing branches, and getting completed tasks verified and deployed to production. It's all about automating the little steps because details are too easy to forget.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Rob Kaufman explores tools and options for improving your development process: common issues with managing tasks, starting work, committing branches, and getting completed tasks verified and deployed to production. It's all about automating the little steps because details are too easy to forget.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 104: Send SMS Messages and Make Phone Calls From Your App With Twilio
item.description:
Brian Levine shows how easy it is to add phone services to your application using Twilio. Twilio wraps powerful telecom infrastructure with a simple REST API and offers pay-as-you-go pricing with cloud scalability.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Brian Levine shows how easy it is to add phone services to your application using Twilio. Twilio wraps powerful telecom infrastructure with a simple REST API and offers pay-as-you-go pricing with cloud scalability.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 103: HTML5 Quick Start with Compass-html5-boilerplate
item.description: Peter Gumeson shows off his compass-html5-boilerplate gem, which uses Compass to make it easier to integrate the HTML5 Boilerplate template into Rails apps.
item.itunes:summary: Peter Gumeson shows off his compass-html5-boilerplate gem, which uses Compass to make it easier to integrate the HTML5 Boilerplate template into Rails apps.

item.title: Episode 102: Newick-Ruby: A Gem for Manipulating Newick Format Trees
item.description:
Jonathan Badger explores Newick format trees, and how to manipulate them using his Newick-ruby gem.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Jonathan Badger explores Newick format trees, and how to manipulate them using his Newick-ruby gem.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 101: TRegexp: Friendly Regular Expressions
item.description:
Ian Young introduces his first gem, a human-friendly DSL for regular expressions.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Ian Young introduces his first gem, a human-friendly DSL for regular expressions.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 100: Getting Oriented with Compass
item.description:
Patrick Crowley shows how to turbo-charge your layouts with Compass, a lightweight stylesheet framework built on top of Haml and Sass.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Patrick Crowley shows how to turbo-charge your layouts with Compass, a lightweight stylesheet framework built on top of Haml and Sass.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 099: Omniauth: Future Proof Your Authentication
item.description:
Kevin Ball shows how the traditional model of username/password authentication is dying, and how Omniauth makes it all rainbows and sunshine going forward.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Kevin Ball shows how the traditional model of username/password authentication is dying, and how Omniauth makes it all rainbows and sunshine going forward.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 098: Give Yourself Some Backbone
item.description:
Ryan Weald gives a brief overview of Backbone.js and the advantages it has for your project.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Ryan Weald gives a brief overview of Backbone.js and the advantages it has for your project.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 097: Basic Reporting with Ruby and CouchDB
item.description:
Christopher Petersen shows how to create both basic reports on individual user behavior and aggregate reports across all user activity.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Christopher Petersen shows how to create both basic reports on individual user behavior and aggregate reports across all user activity.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 096: Rounded Corners Everywhere
item.description:
Scott Olmsted explores Javascript libraries to simulate CSS3 decorations on browsers that don't support them. (Yeah, we're talking about you Internet Explorer.)

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Scott Olmsted explores Javascript libraries to simulate CSS3 decorations on browsers that don't support them. (Yeah, we're talking about you Internet Explorer.)
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 095: The State of MacRuby
item.description:
Matt Aimonetti discusses the latest developments with the MacRuby project, which aims to implement Ruby 1.9 directly on top of Mac OS X core technologies.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Matt Aimonetti discusses the latest developments with the MacRuby project, which aims to implement Ruby 1.9 directly on top of Mac OS X core technologies.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 094: Refactoring ActiveRecord Models
item.description:
It's always important to keep your ActiveRecord models in tip-top shape. Ben Hughes explores several techniques for refactoring models and preventing them from getting out of hand.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
It's always important to keep your ActiveRecord models in tip-top shape. Ben Hughes explores several techniques for refactoring models and preventing them from getting out of hand.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 093: Are You Redis?
item.description:
Emanuele Tozzato gives a brief introduction to Redis, then demonstrates real-life database performance optimization with redis-object and how to manage background jobs using Resque.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Emanuele Tozzato gives a brief introduction to Redis, then demonstrates real-life database performance optimization with redis-object and how to manage background jobs using Resque.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 092: File Uploads With S3SwfUpload
item.description:
Nathan Colgate Clark gives a general overview of his Amazon S3 upload plugin (past, present, and future) and shares his thoughts on how it managed to stand out on GitHub.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Nathan Colgate Clark gives a general overview of his Amazon S3 upload plugin (past, present, and future) and shares his thoughts on how it managed to stand out on GitHub.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 091: Message Block
item.description:
Ben Hughes shows off message_block, a gem which simplifies generating flash and error messages. Additionally, Ben discusses how to test gem development using Cucumber and Cukigem.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Ben Hughes shows off message_block, a gem which simplifies generating flash and error messages. Additionally, Ben discusses how to test gem development using Cucumber and Cukigem.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 090: CoffeeScript
item.description:
People are drawn to Ruby by its beautiful syntax, and CoffeeScript brings that same joie de vivre to Javascript. John Lynch shares his experience using CoffeeScript for both web and mobile app development.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
People are drawn to Ruby by its beautiful syntax, and CoffeeScript brings that same joie de vivre to Javascript. John Lynch shares his experience using CoffeeScript for both web and mobile app development.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 089: Ruleby
item.description:
Chris McCann demonstrates Ruleby, a Ruby implementation of a rules engine based on the Rete algorithm.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Chris McCann demonstrates Ruleby, a Ruby implementation of a rules engine based on the Rete algorithm.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 088: Trucker
item.description:
Patrick Crowley talks about Trucker, a new gem that makes it easier to migrate legacy data into Rails apps.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Patrick Crowley talks about Trucker, a new gem that makes it easier to migrate legacy data into Rails apps.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 087: Searching With Solr
item.description:
Get up and running in no time with enterprise-grade search powered by Solr. Nick Zadrozny shows you what Solr can do, how it works, and how you can make the most of it in production.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Get up and running in no time with enterprise-grade search powered by Solr. Nick Zadrozny shows you what Solr can do, how it works, and how you can make the most of it in production.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 086: Mobile Web Apps Using jQTouch
item.description:
Patrick Crowley dives into the world of mobile app development and shows how to use the jQTouch framework to quickly build awesome mobile-optimized web apps.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Patrick Crowley dives into the world of mobile app development and shows how to use the jQTouch framework to quickly build awesome mobile-optimized web apps.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 085: Introduction to Node.js
item.description:
Web standards advocate Edward O'Connor gives a quick introduction to Node.js, a new event-driven networking engine for JavaScript.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Web standards advocate Edward O'Connor gives a quick introduction to Node.js, a new event-driven networking engine for JavaScript.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 084: Quick and Cheap Usability for Programmers
item.description:
Megan O'Rorke introduces the general concept and goal of usability, and shares some quick and cheap usability resources for Ruby developers.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Megan O'Rorke introduces the general concept and goal of usability, and shares some quick and cheap usability resources for Ruby developers.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 083: Testing Philosophies
item.description:
Rob Kaufman discusses common testing philosophies and methodologies in use by the Ruby community.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Rob Kaufman discusses common testing philosophies and methodologies in use by the Ruby community.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 082: Behavior Driven Development Using Ruby, Cucumber, and rSpec
item.description:
Steve Ross gives an introduction to behavior driven development using Ruby, Cucumber, and rSpec. This is a practical how-to for developers who have not yet integrated behavior driven development into their workflow.

Bonus content: download slides and view notes from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Steve Ross gives an introduction to behavior driven development using Ruby, Cucumber, and rSpec. This is a practical how-to for developers who have not yet integrated behavior driven development into their workflow.
Bonus content: download slides and view notes from this talk.

item.title: Episode 081: Rolling with Riak
item.description:
John Lynch from Rigel Group gives an overview of Riak, the newest kid on the NoSQL block, and explains why it should power your next web-scale app.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
John Lynch from Rigel Group gives an overview of Riak, the newest kid on the NoSQL block, and explains why it should power your next web-scale app.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 080: EventMachine, AMQP, and WebSockets: The Musical
item.description: Dan Simpson and Nick Zadrozny give an overview of cutting-edge, real-time programming for the web; and demonstrate an interactive, web-based sequencer.
item.itunes:summary: Dan Simpson and Nick Zadrozny give an overview of cutting-edge, real-time programming for the web; and demonstrate an interactive, web-based sequencer.

item.title: Episode 079: Artificial Stupidity: Adding Smarts to Yer Kode
item.description:
Machine learning and data mining have long been "black arts" because they require access to expensive computing clusters. Randall Thomas discusses machine learning and the problem spaces it can help solve.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Machine learning and data mining have long been "black arts" because they require access to expensive computing clusters. Randall Thomas discusses machine learning and the problem spaces it can help solve.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 078: Scripting Android With Ruby
item.description:
Mark Ranallo will give an introduction to using JRuby in conjunction with the Android Scripting Environment.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Mark Ranallo will give an introduction to using JRuby in conjunction with the Android Scripting Environment.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 077: Building Your Own Hosting Environment
item.description:
Nic Benders will show you what's needed for building a hosting environment for production applications. The focus will be on selecting server hardware, picking a Linux Distro, and getting your Rails app running.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Nic Benders will show you what's needed for building a hosting environment for production applications. The focus will be on selecting server hardware, picking a Linux Distro, and getting your Rails app running.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 076: OpenCyc
item.description:
Guyren Howe gives a way-too-brief demonstration of OpenCyc, an AI technology based on the world's most comprehensive general-purpose ontology. Along the way, he reveals how to talk to OpenCyc using JRuby.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Guyren Howe gives a way-too-brief demonstration of OpenCyc, an AI technology based on the world's most comprehensive general-purpose ontology. Along the way, he reveals how to talk to OpenCyc using JRuby.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 075: Heroku
item.description: Blake Mizerany from Heroku shows off the company's cloud platform for Ruby applications. The talk covers Heroku basics, Sinatra, Ruby development, and scaling.
item.itunes:summary: Blake Mizerany from Heroku shows off the company's cloud platform for Ruby applications. The talk covers Heroku basics, Sinatra, Ruby development, and scaling.

item.title: Episode 074: Moonshine: 190 Proof Deployment
item.description:
Jarin Udom shows how to set up a full Rails stack and deploy your app on a bare Ubuntu server in 10 minutes. Is he drunk? Find out!

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Jarin Udom shows how to set up a full Rails stack and deploy your app on a bare Ubuntu server in 10 minutes. Is he drunk? Find out!
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 073: Cappuccino
item.description:
Cappuccino is a framework for building desktop-caliber applications that run in a web browser. Brian Chapados reviews the design concepts of Cappuccino and the underlying Objective-J language, shows how to get started, and builds a simple app for searching scientific literature databases.

This talk was part of the DjangoSD/SD Ruby mashup meeting.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Cappuccino is a framework for building desktop-caliber applications that run in a web browser. Brian Chapados reviews the design concepts of Cappuccino and the underlying Objective-J language, shows how to get started, and builds a simple app for searching scientific literature databases.
This talk was part of the DjangoSD/SD Ruby mashup meeting.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 072: MongoDB
item.description:
Scott Motte introduces us to the document-oriented database MongoDB and shows how to use MongoDB as an alternative to MySQL and ActiveRecord using the MongoMapper gem.

This talk was part of the DjangoSD/SD Ruby mashup meeting.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Scott Motte introduces us to the document-oriented database MongoDB and shows how to use MongoDB as an alternative to MySQL and ActiveRecord using the MongoMapper gem.
This talk was part of the DjangoSD/SD Ruby mashup meeting.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 071: Mess of Protocols
item.description:
Guyren Howe discusses how we use different applications and protocols to govern how we communicate: with whom, how privately, how immediately, whether through text/video/whatever, and so on. He proposes we decouple these ideas, which would simplify and enrich the ways we communicate.

This talk was part of the DjangoSD/SD Ruby mashup meeting.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Guyren Howe discusses how we use different applications and protocols to govern how we communicate: with whom, how privately, how immediately, whether through text/video/whatever, and so on. He proposes we decouple these ideas, which would simplify and enrich the ways we communicate.
This talk was part of the DjangoSD/SD Ruby mashup meeting.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 070: Processing Real-world HTML
item.description:
Edward O'Connor from djangosd gives an overview of html5lib, a major-desktop-browser-compatible HTML parser and tokenizer for both Ruby and Python.

This talk was part of the DjangoSD/SD Ruby mashup meeting.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Edward O'Connor from djangosd gives an overview of html5lib, a major-desktop-browser-compatible HTML parser and tokenizer for both Ruby and Python.
This talk was part of the DjangoSD/SD Ruby mashup meeting.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 069: Rails 3: From Vaporware to Awesomeness in 12 Months
item.description:
Yehuda Katz returns to San Diego with a report on the latest developments with the Ruby on Rails web application framework.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Yehuda Katz returns to San Diego with a report on the latest developments with the Ruby on Rails web application framework.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 068: Hybrid iPhone Apps with Titanium Mobile
item.description:
Scott Motte talks about iPhone development using the Titanium Mobile framework, including how to build a basic app.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Scott Motte talks about iPhone development using the Titanium Mobile framework, including how to build a basic app.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 067: Cooking up a Cloud (with Chef & EC2)
item.description:
Chef is a young and ambitious Ruby DSL built for easy configuration management. Nick Zadrozny will take a look at the philosophy of configuration management, the basics of Chef, and some recipes to build out a basic Rails server.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Chef is a young and ambitious Ruby DSL built for easy configuration management. Nick Zadrozny will take a look at the philosophy of configuration management, the basics of Chef, and some recipes to build out a basic Rails server.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 066: Unit Testing: The Easy Way
item.description:
With Rspec and Cucumber, Ruby has brought testing to a whole new level, but tests still require a lot of work.

But things just got better. Llewellyn Falco will show you new patterns and practices to dramatically decrease the amount of effort needed to test.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
With Rspec and Cucumber, Ruby has brought testing to a whole new level, but tests still require a lot of work.
But things just got better. Llewellyn Falco will show you new patterns and practices to dramatically decrease the amount of effort needed to test.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 065: HotRuby + jQuery: Ruby in the Browser
item.description: Daniel Moore will demonstrate using the HotRuby VM to execute Ruby code natively in the browser. The demonstration shows how Ruby can call native JS libraries, like jQuery, to perform DOM manipulation.
item.itunes:summary: Daniel Moore will demonstrate using the HotRuby VM to execute Ruby code natively in the browser. The demonstration shows how Ruby can call native JS libraries, like jQuery, to perform DOM manipulation.

item.title: Episode 064: Ruby 1.9.1
item.description:
Bradly Feeley reviews the new features and syntax changes in the latest production ready Ruby release, Ruby 1.9.1.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Bradly Feeley reviews the new features and syntax changes in the latest production ready Ruby release, Ruby 1.9.1.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 063: Earning an "A" in YSlow
item.description: Nick Zadrozny takes us on a tour of basic website performance optimization, covering 13 optimizations you shouldn't deploy your site without. He'll also go over some sample implementations for a typical Rails app, including a demo of how to serve your public assets from Amazon's new CloudFront CDN.
item.itunes:summary: Nick Zadrozny takes us on a tour of basic website performance optimization, covering 13 optimizations you shouldn't deploy your site without. He'll also go over some sample implementations for a typical Rails app, including a demo of how to serve your public assets from Amazon's new CloudFront CDN.

item.title: Episode 062: Track Magic
item.description: Jim Rea will demonstrate Track Magic, a plugin for Panorama that allows Rails developers to interact directly with Rails databases on the desktop without a browser.
item.itunes:summary: Jim Rea will demonstrate Track Magic, a plugin for Panorama that allows Rails developers to interact directly with Rails databases on the desktop without a browser.

item.title: Episode 061: Tanning Bed
item.description:
Rob Kaufman demonstrates Tanning Bed, his new Solr search mixin for any Ruby class. Tanning Bed makes fewer assumptions about how you want to deal with the Solr search engine, while still providing easy Ruby-like interfaces.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Rob Kaufman demonstrates Tanning Bed, his new Solr search mixin for any Ruby class. Tanning Bed makes fewer assumptions about how you want to deal with the Solr search engine, while still providing easy Ruby-like interfaces.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 060: Migrating Legacy Data
item.description:
Let's face it. Migrating legacy data into a new app is a giant pain in the ass. It's slow, error prone, and a ton of work.

What if you could import old data into a new app before it's finished? Normalize fields? Clean up old data? And migrate often? Patrick Crowley shows the way.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Let's face it. Migrating legacy data into a new app is a giant pain in the ass. It's slow, error prone, and a ton of work.
What if you could import old data into a new app before it's finished? Normalize fields? Clean up old data? And migrate often? Patrick Crowley shows the way.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 059: Rails Case Study
item.description: Guyren Howe is doing something a little different with his current project, trying to make it more user-modifiable and user friendly than your average intraweb application, and removing some of the redundancy in regular Rails code. The current state of the project will be discussed, along with whether the interesting parts should be open sourced.
item.itunes:summary: Guyren Howe is doing something a little different with his current project, trying to make it more user-modifiable and user friendly than your average intraweb application, and removing some of the redundancy in regular Rails code. The current state of the project will be discussed, along with whether the interesting parts should be open sourced.

item.title: Episode 058: MacRuby: What's the big deal?
item.description:
Last year, Apple released MacRuby, an open source Ruby implementation written on top of the Objective-C runtime. Writing native MacOSX applications in Ruby without having to pay the cost of using a bridge is now a reality. This is an important milestone for Ruby, Apple and the Ruby community.

Matt Aimonetti will explain the implementation, show how to build desktop applications with MacRuby & HotCocoa, and discuss why Ruby developers should add this new tool to their utility belt. Matt will also talk about the future of MacRuby.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Last year, Apple released MacRuby, an open source Ruby implementation written on top of the Objective-C runtime. Writing native MacOSX applications in Ruby without having to pay the cost of using a bridge is now a reality. This is an important milestone for Ruby, Apple and the Ruby community.
Matt Aimonetti will explain the implementation, show how to build desktop applications with MacRuby & HotCocoa, and discuss why Ruby developers should add this new tool to their utility belt. Matt will also talk about the future of MacRuby.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 057: Facebooker Plugin
item.description: Michael Madrid discusses Styleact (a Facebook application) and how to develop Facebook apps using Ruby on Rails and the Facebooker plugin.
item.itunes:summary: Michael Madrid discusses Styleact (a Facebook application) and how to develop Facebook apps using Ruby on Rails and the Facebooker plugin.

item.title: Episode 056: Ruby 1.9 or Bust!
item.description:
Rob Kaufman talks about his new Ruby 1.9 or Bust project. The project is dedicated to updating popular Ruby gems to be Ruby 1.9 compatible, and is seeking donations to hire a full-time developer to work on porting gems.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Rob Kaufman talks about his new Ruby 1.9 or Bust project. The project is dedicated to updating popular Ruby gems to be Ruby 1.9 compatible, and is seeking donations to hire a full-time developer to work on porting gems.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 055: MySQL, Postgres, and Rails
item.description:
Guyren Howe has considerable experience with both MySQL and PostgreSQL. He discusses the myriad technical and other advantages to using PostgreSQL instead of MySQL for, well, pretty much anything.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Guyren Howe has considerable experience with both MySQL and PostgreSQL. He discusses the myriad technical and other advantages to using PostgreSQL instead of MySQL for, well, pretty much anything.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 054: Paperclip
item.description:
Patrick Crowley talks about Paperclip, a lightweight plugin for handling attachments.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Patrick Crowley talks about Paperclip, a lightweight plugin for handling attachments.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 053: Ruby Arduino Development (RAD)
item.description:
Sensors and servos in hand, JD Barnhart shows off the current state of RAD, the Rails inspired framework bringing convention over configuration and Ruby sensibility to the Arduino Physical computing platform.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Sensors and servos in hand, JD Barnhart shows off the current state of RAD, the Rails inspired framework bringing convention over configuration and Ruby sensibility to the Arduino Physical computing platform.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 052: Shadow
item.description: Jordan Fowler reveals his new Shadow plugin that tracks attribute and association changes to ActiveRecord objects, making it easy to create activity feeds for your application.
item.itunes:summary: Jordan Fowler reveals his new Shadow plugin that tracks attribute and association changes to ActiveRecord objects, making it easy to create activity feeds for your application.

item.title: Episode 051: Archaeopteryx
item.description: Giles Bowkett shows off his mega-cool MIDI scaffolding generator for creating dance music with Ruby.
item.itunes:summary: Giles Bowkett shows off his mega-cool MIDI scaffolding generator for creating dance music with Ruby.

item.title: Episode 050: One-man Lightning Talk
item.description: Kevin Clark is back again and talking about his latest work: Rubinius, grammar parsing from ruby, kqueue, and massive build systems.
item.itunes:summary: Kevin Clark is back again and talking about his latest work: Rubinius, grammar parsing from ruby, kqueue, and massive build systems.

item.title: Episode 049: Intro to EC2
item.description:
Chris Petersen gives an introduction to working with Amazon EC2, and discusses the advantages and disadvantage to hosting your Ruby applications there.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Chris Petersen gives an introduction to working with Amazon EC2, and discusses the advantages and disadvantage to hosting your Ruby applications there.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 048: Ruby for Data Processing
item.description:
Brian Chapados talks about using ruby & rake to build a simple workflow to coordinate external processes.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Brian Chapados talks about using ruby & rake to build a simple workflow to coordinate external processes.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 047: Lazy Indexing
item.description:
Matt Aimonetti shows how to quickly get your database queries to run faster when you are not a DBA and are running out of time.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Matt Aimonetti shows how to quickly get your database queries to run faster when you are not a DBA and are running out of time.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 046: RSpec in 15 minutes
item.description:
Cliff Rhyne describes in 15 minutes what it takes to get up and running with RSpec.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Cliff Rhyne describes in 15 minutes what it takes to get up and running with RSpec.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 045: Merb
item.description:
Much like Rails, Merb is a MVC web-framework written in Ruby. In this talk, Jordan Fowler introduces Merb and presents some of the distinctions and tradeoffs between the two frameworks.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Much like Rails, Merb is a MVC web-framework written in Ruby. In this talk, Jordan Fowler introduces Merb and presents some of the distinctions and tradeoffs between the two frameworks.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 044: Ext JavaScript Library
item.description: Adam Grant talks about his experiences using Ext, a new Javascript library for creating advanced UI controls (like grids, trees, progress bars, etc).
item.itunes:summary: Adam Grant talks about his experiences using Ext, a new Javascript library for creating advanced UI controls (like grids, trees, progress bars, etc).

item.title: Episode 043: Facebook API
item.description:
John Bresnik discusses the ruby library for the Facebook API, Facebooker, based on his production experience building Facebook applications. Presentation includes general overview of the Facebook API, Facebooker specifics, as well as code examples.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
John Bresnik discusses the ruby library for the Facebook API, Facebooker, based on his production experience building Facebook applications. Presentation includes general overview of the Facebook API, Facebooker specifics, as well as code examples.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 042: Deploying Rails on Slicehost
item.description:
Jared Kuolt shows how to quickly deploy your Rails application to a Slicehost VPS. This talk covers installing MySQL, Nginx, Rails and Mongrel, as well as deployment using Capistrano.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Jared Kuolt shows how to quickly deploy your Rails application to a Slicehost VPS. This talk covers installing MySQL, Nginx, Rails and Mongrel, as well as deployment using Capistrano.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 041: MySQL Clustering
item.description:
Rob Kaufman takes on database scaling with MySQL. This talk will walk you through setting up a Master (read write) Slave (read only) MySQL network, as well as a Master Master, or Multi-Master network. The talk will also cover the whys and when of database clustering.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Rob Kaufman takes on database scaling with MySQL. This talk will walk you through setting up a Master (read write) Slave (read only) MySQL network, as well as a Master Master, or Multi-Master network. The talk will also cover the whys and when of database clustering.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 040: Unobtrusive Javascript
item.description:
Matt Aimonetti lays down the law on best-practice Ajax, using behavior oriented javascript with progressive enhancement.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Matt Aimonetti lays down the law on best-practice Ajax, using behavior oriented javascript with progressive enhancement.
Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.

item.title: Episode 039: ActionMailer in Action
item.description:
Rob Kaufman talks about using ActionMailer safely, how to keep out of the spam box and how to test your emails before your customers see them.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Rob Kaufman talks about using ActionMailer safely, how to keep out of the spam box and how to test your emails before your customers see them.

item.title: Episode 038: Haml and Sass in 15 minutes
item.description:
Patrick Crowley gets you up to speed on using Haml and Sass. Haml is a drop in replacement for ERB that turns your views into beautiful code poetry. Sass does the same for CSS.

Bonus content: download the slides from this talk.
item.itunes:summary:
Patrick Crowley gets you up to speed on using Haml and Sass. Haml is a drop in replacement for ERB that turns your views into beautiful code poetry. Sass does the same for CSS.

item.title: Episode 037: Rails Sexy Charts
item.description:
Matt Aimonetti demonstrates how to create awesome, Flash-powered charts by integrating Rails with amCharts.

item.title: Episode 036: The Return of Kevin Clark
item.description: Kevin Clark takes a break from Powerset to give a full-throttle talk on using Merb as a JSON-RPC service, god, gem2rpm, and heckle.
item.itunes:summary: Kevin Clark takes a break from Powerset to give a full-throttle talk on using Merb as a JSON-RPC service, god, gem2rpm, and heckle.

item.itunes:summary: Matt Aimonetti demonstrates his newest plugins: ActiveRecord Backup and MimetypeFu.

item.title: Episode 034: Intro to JRuby
item.description: Brian Chapados shows how to install and work with the latest JRuby release.
item.itunes:summary: Brian Chapados shows how to install and work with the latest JRuby release.

item.title: Episode 033: Life on Edge
item.description: If you're a Rails junkie, you'll want to develop on Edge Rails. Matt Clark explains how to get started and shares some of the challenges of working on Edge.
item.itunes:summary: If you're a Rails junkie, you'll want to develop on Edge Rails. Matt Clark explains how to get started and shares some of the challenges of working on Edge.

item.title: Episode 032: Capistrano
item.description: Rob Kaufman takes on Capistrano 2. What is it? How does it work? What's changed since version 1?
item.itunes:summary: Rob Kaufman takes on Capistrano 2. What is it? How does it work? What's changed since version 1?

item.title: Episode 031: Seaside
item.description: Roger Whitney explores Seaside, the web application framework based on Smalltalk.
item.itunes:summary: Roger Whitney explores Seaside, the web application framework based on Smalltalk.

item.title: Episode 030: Tuneshelf
item.description: Dominic Damian talks about his experiences building Tuneshelf, a web application that allows music fans to keep track of their favorite music albums.
item.itunes:summary: Dominic Damian talks about his experiences building Tuneshelf, a web application that allows music fans to keep track of their favorite music albums.

item.title: Episode 029: Big Stinking Piles (of data)
item.description: What do you do when third-party data vendors don't speak REST? Rob Kaufman discuss real-world techniques for importing and exporting data. (This talk was also given at RailsConf 2007.)
item.itunes:summary: What do you do when third-party data vendors don't speak REST? Rob Kaufman discuss real-world techniques for importing and exporting data. (This talk was also given at RailsConf 2007.)

item.title: Episode 028: Simple Sidebar Plugin
item.description: Ryan Felton shows how to use Simple Sidebar plugin to DRY up sidebar content in applications.
item.itunes:summary: Ryan Felton shows how to use Simple Sidebar plugin to DRY up sidebar content in applications.

item.title: Episode 027: Headliner and Styler
item.description: Patrick Crowley talks about his newest plugins: Headliner and Styler.
item.itunes:summary: Patrick Crowley talks about his newest plugins: Headliner and Styler.

item.title: Episode 026: ActsAsSolr
item.description: Rob Kaufman shows how easy it is to integrate Solr powered search into your Rails application using the ActsAsSolr plugin.
item.itunes:summary: Rob Kaufman shows how easy it is to integrate Solr powered search into your Rails application using the ActsAsSolr plugin.

item.title: Episode 025: Ajax CSS Star Rating with ActsAsRateable
item.description: Ryan Felton shows off how to build an Ajax-powered, CSS star rater using the ActsAsRateable plugin and Komodo Media's CSS Star Rating Redux technique.
item.itunes:summary: Ryan Felton shows off how to build an Ajax-powered, CSS star rater using the ActsAsRateable plugin and Komodo Media's CSS Star Rating Redux technique.

item.title: Episode 024: Using Ruby + Amazon SQS to build backdoors
item.description: Brian Chapados talks about using Ruby and Amazon's Simple Que Service web service to build backdoors into systems.
item.itunes:summary: Brian Chapados talks about using Ruby and Amazon's Simple Que Service web service to build backdoors into systems.

item.title: Episode 023: RubyInline
item.description: Nick Zadrozny shows us how to use C in Ruby with RubyInline. As an example, Nick walks us through writing a password-generating application with the help of Diceware.
item.itunes:summary: Nick Zadrozny shows us how to use C in Ruby with RubyInline. As an example, Nick walks us through writing a password-generating application with the help of Diceware.

item.title: Episode 022: DRP
item.description: DRP stands for Directed Ruby Programming. In this episode, Warren Henning explains exactly what that means and why you might be interested in it.
item.itunes:summary: DRP stands for Directed Ruby Programming. In this episode, Warren Henning explains exactly what that means and why you might be interested in it.

item.title: Episode 021: Merb
item.description: Chris Van Pelt gives us an introduction to Merb. Merb is a Ruby framework built by Ezra Zygmuntowicz.
item.itunes:summary: Chris Van Pelt gives us an introduction to Merb. Merb is a Ruby framework built by Ezra Zygmuntowicz.

item.title: Episode 020: ImageScience
item.description: In this episode, Tom Werner covers some of the basics of the ruby image library ImageScience. ImageScience is a wrapper for the FreeImage graphics library, and is a lightweight alternative to RMagick.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Tom Werner covers some of the basics of the ruby image library ImageScience. ImageScience is a wrapper for the FreeImage graphics library, and is a lightweight alternative to RMagick.

item.description: Jordan Fowler gives a presentation on Amazon's S3 service. He also covers the AWS::S3 gem written by Marcel Molina Jr.
item.itunes:summary: Jordan Fowler gives a presentation on Amazon's S3 service. He also covers the AWS::S3 gem written by Marcel Molina Jr.

item.title: Episode 018: StaffTool
item.description: In this episode, Toby Sterrett gives us an update on his soon-to-be-released project StaffTool. StaffTool is a web-based church management application build with Ruby on Rails.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Toby Sterrett gives us an update on his soon-to-be-released project StaffTool. StaffTool is a web-based church management application build with Ruby on Rails.

item.title: Episode 017: ActsNaked
item.description: In today's episode, Patrick Crowley introduces his first Rails plugin titled ActsNaked. It's an easy way to strip your models and keep them DRY.
item.itunes:summary: In today's episode, Patrick Crowley introduces his first Rails plugin titled ActsNaked. It's an easy way to strip your models and keep them DRY.

item.title: Episode 016: MasterView Templates
item.description: Deb Lewis showcases her project MasterView. MasterView is a template language for Rails.
item.itunes:summary: Deb Lewis showcases her project MasterView. MasterView is a template language for Rails.

item.title: Episode 015: Rails for Legacy Applications
item.description: Patrick Crowley covers some of the finer point of using Rails with legacy applications.
item.itunes:summary: Patrick Crowley covers some of the finer point of using Rails with legacy applications.

item.title: Episode 014: Ruby Idioms - Part 1
item.description: Tom Werner gives us part 1 of his series on Ruby idoms.

item.title: Episode 013: Mocha and Stubba
item.description: Kevin Clark shows us how to use mocks and stubs in your Ruby tests using Mocha and Stubba
item.itunes:summary: Kevin Clark shows us how to use mocks and stubs in your Ruby tests using Mocha and Stubba

item.title: Episode 012: Deployment
item.description: Dominic Damian talks about the different options available to you when deploying a Rails application. He covers areas such as servers, caching, database, and hosting.
item.itunes:summary: Dominic Damian talks about the different options available to you when deploying a Rails application. He covers areas such as servers, caching, database, and hosting.

item.title: Episode 011: ActsAsTaggable Plugin
item.description: Patrick Crowley discusses his experiences with actsastaggable. He starts off outlining some of the differences between the gem and the plugin. Patrick then creates a simple app to show off some of the capabilities of the plugin.
item.itunes:summary: Patrick Crowley discusses his experiences with actsastaggable. He starts off outlining some of the differences between the gem and the plugin. Patrick then creates a simple app to show off some of the capabilities of the plugin.

item.title: Episode 010: REST Web Services with Rails
item.description:
Chris Abad talks a little bit about providing web services to your Rails application using some of the new REST features found in Edge Rails. At the end, he also throws in a bonus tip on using Rick Olson's authentication plugin restful_authentication to add authentication to your REST API.

Here are the slides
